info.name: Denticulate ligament
info.description: The denticulate ligament is AKA the dentate ligament. It is a serrated, shelf-like extension of the pia mater on each side of the spinal cord that serves to stabilize the cord within the vertebral canal. Each of the 21 pointed processes attaches to the arachoid/dura midway between the roots of the spinal nerves.
